A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Lots of problems as a story and as science fiction---timelines and plot holes. Key characters running around on snipe hunts and thwarted at the last minute from heroism. Wrong people filling in at strange moments.  New rules in space combat without new explanations why these weren't used in the past\, lots of strange decisions justified by unnecessarily hidden plot elements. Deus Ex Machina\, we invoke you.

A theme in The Last Jedi is to forget the past and move on.  Well\, this movie pretty much has done that.  We're down to a Wookie and a character whose actress is now dead.  Much of the good of Star Wars original trilogy is gone\, and it's not just the characters.

Special effects good\, though Snoke's chamber wasn't compelling and fights there were not especially inspiring. Outcome with Snoke's guards completely predictable.  Some interesting uses of force\, but apparently the dark side makes you stupid and blind to the obvious.  Or maybe that's the testosterone that makes all the bad guys stupid at key junctures or something.  Hoth combat redux not very compelling.

Movie was a mess. Parts were entertaining so mostly can be watched without boredom or too much aggravation---if you suspend all your judgement and love for first trilogy.
